Key Match Events: Jake Bauers' ninth-inning RBI single gave the Brewers a 2-1 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies.
Pre-Game Insights: The Brewers were written off due to injuries and departures, but they found a way to win back-to-back division titles for the first time since 1981-82.
Post-Match Reflections: The Brewers benefited from the leadership of manager Pat Murphy, who kept the locker room loose and guided a team that hasnâ€™t endured more than three straight losses at any point this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers have used 17 starting pitchers this season, and 12 different Brewers pitchers have earned a save.
Others: The Brewers' lineup appears to pack more punch, entering Wednesday ranked fourth in runs (733) and 11th in OPS (.735).
